intro: Haplochorema uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flowered haplochorema, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, solitary flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant has a slender, upright stem with few leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists studying plant diversity and adaptation.
